title: ‘Stood up for women, paid with his life’: 20-man gang kills bodybuilder after tiff at wedding
content: A national-level bodybuilder and para-athlete from Rohtak, Rohit Dhankhar, died after being attacked for confronting men harassing women at a wedding. Dhankhar was severely beaten by a group of nearly 20 armed assailants after the wedding ceremony. His family alleges it was a planned murder for standing up for women's dignity.

title: 'Want to live, but what can I do?': UP BLO dies by suicide, another of heart attack amid ‘SIR stress’
content: Two Booth Level Officers (BLOs) in Uttar Pradesh have died while working on electoral roll revisions, one by suicide and another from a heart attack. These incidents bring the total BLO deaths during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise to at least seven, raising concerns about workload and pressure.

title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu flaunts giant wedding ring as she marries Raj Nidimoru
content: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu wed filmmaker Raj Nidimoru on Monday morning. The couple exchanged vows in a private ceremony attended by close family and friends. Samantha shared wedding photos on Instagram, showcasing her red bridal saree and the joyous occasion. The wedding took place at the Ling Bhairavi Temple within the Isha Yoga Centre.

title: 'Is there any law?' Congress MP brings dog to Parliament; BJP slams ‘tamasha’
content: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury sparked controversy by bringing a stray puppy to Parliament grounds, claiming she rescued it from the road. She asserted that "real dogs" who "bite" are already in Parliament, criticizing the government. BJP MP Jagdambika Pal condemned the act as "tamasha" and a breach of protocol, demanding action.

title: OpenAI losses rise; AI boom pressures partners; Oracle–SoftBank–CoreWeave hit $100bn debt
content: OpenAI's partners, including SoftBank and Oracle, are shouldering nearly $100 billion in debt linked to the AI firm, which itself carries minimal debt. This strategy leverages others' balance sheets, with Oracle facing significant market value drops. The financial structure raises systemic concerns as billions flow back to suppliers for computing power.

title: Elon's desi beta: A cheatsheet to desi 'heir' to Tesla CEO's fortune
content: The confusion begins with the name itself. There is no “Sekhar Musk.” The child everyone is talking about is named Strider Sekhar Sirius, one of the twins Musk had with Shivon Zilis in 2021. His name follows the familiar Musk pattern — a blend of science fiction ambience and cosmic allusion — but “Sekhar” stands out precisely because it feels rooted, recognisable and grounded in a very different tradition of knowledge.

title: Haryana lad's murder in UK exposes harsh reality of Indians on foreign soil
content: A disturbing trend of 44 Indian students targeted abroad in just 90 days highlights escalating risks. While violent attacks are few, medical issues, suicides, and accidents claim most lives. Families face immense emotional and financial strain, with calls for enhanced safety measures and systemic support for students navigating a complex global education landscape.

title: Ind vs SA: Marco Jansen explains why dismissing Virat Kohli becomes 'near impossible'
content: South African all-rounder Marco Jansen admitted that once Virat Kohli settles in, he becomes 'almost impossible to stop.' Jansen highlighted that the best chance to dismiss batters like Kohli is within their first 10-15 balls. Despite the challenge, Jansen finds it both 'annoying' and 'fun' to bowl to the Indian superstar, acknowledging Kohli's complete batting prowess.

title: Gmail storage hack: How to keep inbox running smoothly - Check details
content: Running out of Gmail storage? Don't panic! This guide reveals how to quickly free up space by clearing trash, deleting large attachments, and managing newsletters. Learn to use Google's Storage Manager to declutter across Drive and Photos, ensuring smooth performance and avoiding costly upgrades. Maintain a clean inbox with simple, regular habits.

title: Zohran Mamdani, a sharp critic of police surveillance, will soon oversee it
content: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani will retain Police Commissioner Jessica S. Tisch, inheriting her extensive surveillance network, the Domain Awareness System. Despite Mamdani's past concerns about police spying and privacy, he now faces the challenge of balancing public safety with civil liberties, potentially moderating his previous stances.

title: Gross GST collections for November stand at over Rs 1.70 lakh crore; up 0.7 per cent
content: November GST collections surpassed Rs 1.70 lakh crore, marking a slight 0.7% year-on-year increase. Despite this modest rise, the year-to-date performance remains robust with an 8.9% growth. While import GST showed strong momentum, domestic collections and compensation cess experienced declines, with varied state-wise performances.

title: Breakfast pe charcha? Now, DKS 'invites' Sidda for meet
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is slated to visit Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar's residence on December 2, signaling a temporary truce amid internal power tussle. This meeting follows Shivakumar's recent visit to the CM's residence, both aimed at projecting unity as directed by the Congress high command. The move seeks to cool tensions before the legislature session begins.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over a thousand Amazon employees have penned an open letter, warning that the company's rapid AI development is jeopardizing its climate commitments and human workforce.  They argue the pursuit of AI dominance is leading to increased emissions, water scarcity, and job displacement, urging leadership to prioritize ethical AI and environmental responsibility.

title: 10 dohas (couplets) by Kabir which offer life's wisdom in a nutshell
content: Kabir, a 15th-century Bhakti poet, challenged religious dogma with his sharp dohas, emphasizing inner devotion over rituals and caste. A rebel disciple, his colloquial Hindi verses spoke to the soul, influencing Sikhs and sparking the Kabir Panth. His legacy continues to inspire a focus on love, questioning, and introspection.

title: 'PM Modi has hijacked Parliament': Gaurav Gogoi hits out as Winter Session begins
content: Gaurav Gogoi accused Prime Minister Modi of "hijacking Parliament" during the Winter Session, alleging the government refuses to discuss the Indian election system. Gogoi stated that while the opposition is willing to cooperate on government bills, the BJP is not accommodating opposition issues in the parliamentary agenda, undermining democratic functioning.

title: 'Speak to a doctor': RS witnesses Kharge vs Nadda over Dhankhar's 'sudden exit' — watch
content: Rajya Sabha witnessed a heated exchange between Mallikarjun Kharge and JP Nadda on the first day of the Winter Session. Kharge's reference to the "sudden exit" of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar drew sharp criticism from Nadda, who advised him to seek medical help for political frustrations.

title: Leon Draisaitl’s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid’s leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: New labour codes: Major shift in India’s employment regulation—implementation is key
content: India's labour laws have undergone a major overhaul, consolidating 29 laws into four codes effective November 21, 2025. This reform aims to boost workplace safety, ease business, and formalize employment. Businesses must adapt to new wage definitions and extended social security, while navigating short-term challenges like cost recalculations and dual compliance environments.

title: 'Awareness… that's my core': Virat Kohli opens up on mental phase - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's magnificent 135 against South Africa not only secured India's victory but also revealed his current mental clarity. He emphasised 'awareness' of situations and his own emotions as the driving force behind his sustained success. This balanced mindset, cultivated over years, allows him to perform consistently at the highest level.

title: Vintage Virat Kohli: 'Mentally young, hungry, unstoppable' — SA great delivers powerful verdict
content: Former South African pacer Dale Steyn lauded Virat Kohli's enduring ODI relevance, highlighting his "mentally young, fresh, and hungry" approach after a match-winning 135. Steyn emphasised Kohli's vast experience and unwavering self-belief, noting the star batter's palpable excitement for playing for India, even at 37. This stellar performance powered India to a 17-run victory.

title: Trump tariffs hit India’s manufacturing sector! PMI falls to 9-month low in Nov
content: US tariffs have slowed India's manufacturing growth to a nine-month low, impacting sales and production. While exports to other regions remain strong, new export orders saw their slowest rise in over a year. India is negotiating a trade framework with the US to address these tariff challenges, though future output expectations have dipped.

title: Samantha Prabhu weds 'The Family Man' director Raj Nidimoru; actress shares photos
content: Samantha Ruth Prabhu wed Raj Nidimoru today in an intimate ceremony at Isha Yoga Centre's Linga Bhairavi Temple, attended by 30 guests. She wore a red saree. Rumors swirled after Raj's ex-wife's cryptic post; they've been linked since 2024. This follows her 2021 divorce from Naga Chaitanya.

title: Kolkata: Woman 'assaulted, molested' inside moving car for nearly an hour
content: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly drugged, physically assaulted, and molested for nearly an hour inside a moving car after being forced into it near Ambedkar Setu. Police found her abandoned and heavily drugged in the Maidan area and have launched an investigation, reviewing CCTV footage to trace the vehicle and its occupants.

title: 'Payment for betrayal': Man stabs wife over extramarital affair; posts selfie with body
content: A 32-year-old man murdered his estranged wife at a women's hostel in Coimbatore, stabbing her to death over an alleged extramarital affair. He then took a selfie with her body and posted it on WhatsApp with a vengeful message. The accused has been arrested by the Rathinapuri police.

title: Drunk Kerala techie sexually harasses cabin crew on flight
content: A passenger on an Air India flight from Dubai to Hyderabad was apprehended by airport police following allegations of sexual harassment and leaving obscene messages. The accused, identified as Biniyam Nazar, reportedly touched a stewardess inappropriately and left offensive remarks. Authorities registered a case under relevant sections of the law.

title: Ahmedabad man fires six rounds at in-laws’ home after quarrel with wife
content: Panic erupted in Ahmedabad's Subhash Society after Rahul Soni fired six rounds following a domestic dispute with his wife. Soni arrived at his in-laws' residence, argued with his wife, and then discharged firearms outside the bungalow. Police detained Soni and seized the weapons, with no injuries reported.

title: Mumbai businesswoman held at gunpoint, stripped, threatened by pharma officials
content: A Mumbai businesswoman has accused senior pharmaceutical officials of holding her at gunpoint, stripping her, and taking compromising photos and videos at their Mahalaxmi office. The FIR details threats of viral dissemination and fabricated legal cases. Police have registered a case under various sections of sexual violence and criminal intimidation, initiating an investigation.

title: Explainer: Making sense of India’s 8.2% growth - and IMF’s ‘C’ on GDP data
content: India's economy is reportedly growing at an impressive 8.2%, yet the IMF has assigned its national accounts a 'C' grade due to methodological weaknesses. This rating highlights concerns about outdated base years, price deflators, and data granularity, sparking a debate over the accuracy of the reported growth figures.

title: December 2025 school holidays: Winter vacation, Christmas and more -- check list
content: December ushers in a calmer rhythm for schools across India as exams wind down and winter break approaches. With holidays typically falling between December 20 and 31, students look forward to Christmas festivities, year-end events and a brief pause before the new academic rush begins in January. The month brings a mix of festive charm, rest and school-level transitions.

title: China-Japan tensions flare: Maki Otsuki's concert abruptly stopped in Shanghai — watch
content: Japanese singer Maki Otsuki's Shanghai concert was abruptly halted mid-performance due to rising diplomatic tensions between China and Japan. The incident follows remarks by Japan's prime minister regarding Taiwan, leading to Beijing's strong reaction and a wave of cultural exchange cancellations, including other Japanese artists' shows.

title: ‘High probability’: Musk suggests our reality may be simulation
content: Tech mogul Elon Musk believes humanity likely lives in a simulation, citing the rapid evolution of video games from simple graphics to photorealistic experiences. He argues that if this trend continues, simulated realities will become indistinguishable from our own. Musk previously shared this 'simulation hypothesis' on Joe Rogan's podcast, suggesting our existence points to this possibility.

title: Kerala deputy SP suspended for molesting woman in custody, taking bribes
content: A Deputy SP in Kerala, A. Umesh, has been suspended. Allegations of sexual assault and bribery against him emerged after a police officer's suicide. An internal inquiry found Umesh misused his position. The Home Department suspended him based on the state police chief's recommendation. This action follows a review of a special report detailing grave misconduct. Disciplinary action is pending.

title: Pune shocker: Cab driver kills partner over marriage pressure, burns body; arrested
content: A 33-year-old cab driver was arrested for allegedly murdering his married partner in Pune and setting her body ablaze in Dharashiv district. The suspect confessed to killing the woman, who was reportedly pressuring him for marriage, to escape the relationship. He then transported her body and set it on fire.

title: Haryana youth stabbed to death in UK: 6 arrested suspects granted bail
content: A Haryana family seeks government help to bring home the body of Vijay Kumar Sheoran. The 29-year-old student died in the UK after a stabbing incident. His brother has written to the External Affairs Ministry for urgent assistance. The family hopes for his last rites to be performed in their village.

title: Winter Session: PM Modi welcomes Vice-President CP Radhakrishnan as Parliament opens — Watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan to the Rajya Sabha on the first day of Winter Session, highlighting his dedication to social service and his connection with tribal communities in Jharkhand. PM Modi assured the House's cooperation, emphasizing decorum and policy over slogans, while also urging the opposition to move past recent election defeats.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal rises; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold and silver futures opened strongly on Monday, buoyed by a weakening dollar, anticipated US Federal Reserve rate cuts, and a depreciating rupee. Silver futures reached a new peak, with analysts expecting continued strong momentum driven by global economic factors and currency fluctuations.

title: 'Why talk about Kohli's future?': India coach shuts down noise; hints at 2027 WC plans
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak firmly dismissed speculation surrounding Virat Kohli's ODI future, emphasising his current form, fitness, and crucial contributions. Kotak stated that discussions about the 2027 World Cup are premature, as the team focuses on present performance. He highlighted Kohli's recent century as proof of his continued value, assuring that the veteran remains central to India's plans.

title: Red Fort blast probe widens: NIA raids ‘Madam Surgeon’; Lucknow home searched
content: NIA widened its probe into a "white-collar" terror network linked to the Red Fort blast, conducting searches in Jammu & Kashmir and Uttar Pradesh. The investigation focuses on a sophisticated module involving educated professionals accused of funneling funds for terror activities, with former medical faculty Dr. Shaheen Shahid among those arrested.

title: Govt to replace GST compensation cess on tobacco, pan masala; Here's what you should know
content: Parliament's Winter Session sees the government proposing new excise duty on tobacco and a 'Health Security–National Security Cess' for pan masala. These measures aim to maintain tax revenue post-GST compensation cess expiry, ensuring continued fiscal space for public health and national security initiatives. The shift aligns with a new 40% GST slab for demerit goods.

title: Oxford word of the year: It's ‘rage bait’ — here's what it means
content: Oxford University Press has declared 'rage bait' the Word of the Year 2025, citing a threefold surge in online usage. This term describes content intentionally crafted to provoke anger and boost engagement.  Its selection highlights a significant shift in how online attention, interaction, and ethics are perceived and manipulated in the digital sphere.

title: 'Even husbands don’t give Rs 100': Maha minister asks Ladki Bahin beneficiaries to 'stay loyal' to CM
content: Maharashtra minister Jaykumar Gore urged women beneficiaries of the Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin scheme to vote for Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. Addressing a rally, Gore advised women to accept money from any source but to remember the Rs 1,500 monthly stipend, warning it would stop if Fadnavis wasn't in power. He emphasized loyalty to the CM during upcoming civic polls.

title: Anthony Davis shares heartfelt 3-word message to JJ Redick after Lakers clash
content: Anthony Davis expressed strong admiration for his former coach, JJ Redick, after facing him for the first time post-trade.  Despite the Lakers' loss to the Mavericks, Davis highlighted their enduring bond, recalling Redick's debut season as a learning experience for both.  This encounter underscored the mutual respect between the two as their NBA careers progress.

title: ‘Want father, brothers to be hanged’: Teen 'marries' boyfriend’s corpse
content: A 18-year-old woman in Nanded accused her father and brothers of murdering her 25-year-old Buddhist boyfriend due to their inter-caste relationship. She performed symbolic wedding rituals before his funeral and demanded capital punishment for the accused. Police have arrested the family members and others involved in the brutal killing.

title: Delhi-NCR AQI 8-year best: Pollution dips between Jan and Nov; only 3 ‘severe’ days in 2025
content: Delhi-NCR breathes easier this year, achieving its best air quality in eight years, excluding 2020.  Average AQI and severe pollution days have significantly dropped.  PM2.5 and PM10 levels are also at their lowest since 2018.  Revised GRAP guidelines now place stricter measures under Stage III, impacting office operations.  However, allegations of data manipulation and lax enforcement have surfaced.

title: Supreme Court entrusts CBI with pan-India probe into digital arrest cases
content: The Bench asked the States, including Opposition ruled West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Telangana, to accord assent to CBI for probing digital arrest cases

title: Lok Sabha passes resolution for election of two House members to IISc Bengaluru Council
content: Lok Sabha approves election of two members to IISc Bengaluru Council, enhancing governance and strategic development of the premier institution

title: 18th Bihar Assembly commences with swearing in of newly elected members
content: The session comes close on the heels of the assembly polls in which the ruling NDA won a brute majority, bagging 202 out of 243 seats

title: Winter session: Parliament panels get more time to submit reports on insolvency, Jan Vishwas provisions Bills
content: Lok Sabha has allowed time till the last day of the Winter session for report on the Insolvency bill, and end of second week of session for Jan Viswas Bill report

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Nellore, Tirupati continue to receive light rain on December 1
content: On December 2, heavy rain, accompanied with squally winds with speed reaching 40- 50 kmph, and gusting up to 60 kmph, is likely at isolated places across Andhra Pradesh

title: PM Modi announces ex-gratia for bereaved families of Sivaganga road accident
content: At least 11 persons were killed and 50 others were injured when two buses of the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) collided near Nachiyarpuram at Thirupathur in Sivaganga district

title: Need framework to deal with challenge of biological weapons: Jaishankar
content: ‘Misuse’ of biological weapons by non-State actors is no longer a distant possibility and international cooperation is needed to combat such a challenge, says External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar

title: Maharashtra woman ‘marries’ corpse after kin kill man she loved over caste differences
content: Videos of Aanchal Mamidwar’s act at the deceased youth’s house and her call for her family to be hanged for the killing went viral on social media

title: ATF price hiked by 5.4%, commercial LPG rates cut
content: Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum revise Aviation Turbine Fuel and Liquefied Petroleum Gas prices on the first day of every month based on international benchmarks and the exchange rate

title: Decathlon opens multi-sport ecosystem at Whitefield in Bengaluru
content: The 60,000 sqft store can host coaching sessions for basketball, football, skating, pickleball, and gymnastics, along with workshops, a kids’ zone, a yoga and dance studio, weekly cycling and running meetups, sports birthday parties

title: Supreme Court declines to entertain plea for time extension to upload waqf details on UMEED portal
content: Supreme Court emphasises adherence to UMEED portal deadlines, allowing petitioners to seek relief from the waqf tribunal amid concerns over technical issues hindering property registration

title: BJP-ally IPFT to maintain separate political entity: Party president Prem Kumar Reang
content: The statement came days after the Tipra Motha Party organised a rally under the banner of 'One North East'

title: Watch: Israel’s Netanyahu seeks pardon in years-long corruption trial
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has formally submitted a pardon request amid ongoing corruption trials, calling the long-running cases “tearing the country apart”.

title: Tamil Nadu government and iVP Semi launch ‘TN 100 Chip Varsity’ project to build semiconductor talent network
content: The project has a dual mandate: enabling the development of 100 new chip designs and training 5,000 students in advanced semiconductor design skills annually.

title: Bomb threats to Kerala CM’s residence, private bank in capital city ahead of President’s visit
content: E-mail received by Chief Minister’s Office reportedly claimed that RDX explosives have been planted by a group involving LTTE and a Karachi-based Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) cell. Police launch extensive checks

title: India's manufacturing sector activity falls to 9-month low in November on softer rise in sales, production: PMI
content: The seasonally adjusted HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) fell from 59.2 in October to 56.6 in November, highlighting the slowest improvement in operating conditions since February

title: Rajya Sabha witnesses heated exchange as Kharge brings up former V-P Dhankhar’s ‘sudden exit’
content: LoP Kharge brought up the “completely unexpected and sudden exit” of Jagdeep Dhankhar from the office of the Chair of Rajya Sabha

title: Supreme Court to hear plea against forcing Tamil Nadu Anganwadi workers into BLO work under threat of punishment, job loss
content: Senior advocate Gopal Sankaranarayanan said Anganwadi workers were under “severe pressure” to attain “targets” in the distribution of enumeration forms for the SIR

title: Thane court acquits all seven accused in cable theft case filed under MCOCA
content: Special MCOCA court judge V.G. Mohite ruled that the entire chain of evidence suffered from major legal and procedural lapses

title: Punjab Vigilance Bureau arrests close aide of jailed Akali leader Bikram Majithia
content: Harpreet Singh Gulati, who is in the liquor trade, was arrested on Saturday, they said. During the probe, the Bureau detected a transaction of ₹10 crore between Gulati's companies and firms run by the Majithia family

title: Opposition using Parliament to vent out frustration: PM Modi
content: PM Modi said the session must not become a stage for political theatrics but a platform for constructive and result-driven debate

title: ED notice to Kerala CM ‘a joke’, says KPCC chief Sunny Joseph
content: Sunny Joseph says the notice will have ‘same plight as previous ones’ issued by ED against Chief Minister and his son

title: Mayawati calls for smooth Winter Session of Parliament to address key public issues
content: In a post on X, the former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister cautioned that, like previous sessions, the Winter Session is expected to witness considerable uproar

title: India evacuates last batch of stranded citizens from Sri Lanka, intensifies relief efforts
content: Under Operation Sagar Bandhu, the last batch of 104 Indian passengers stranded at Bandaranaike International Airport in Colombo reached Thiruvananthapuram, onboard an IAF aircraft

title: VMRDA sets May 2026 deadline for seven road projects linking Vizag to Bhogapuram airport
content: Road projects have slowed down owing to land acquisition challenges, with the toughest hurdle being the takeover of 75 acres; on the other hand, validation flight at the international airport is scheduled to take place this month

title: CM Rio renews demand to lift Protected Area Permit regime from Nagaland
content: The CM said that although the Centre has relaxed the PAP requirement for Nagaland from December 1 to 10 to facilitate the Hornbill Festival, the temporary measure "does not solve the larger issue"

title: ED issues show-cause notice to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan in KIIFB masala bond probe
content: Former Finance Minister T.M. Thomas Isaac and KIIFB Chief Executive Officer K.M. Abraham too receive notices. ED notice is related to alleged use of funds raised through the bonds to purchase land and alleged violation of FEMA norms

title: Mamata to scale up anti-SIR campaign with rallies in Malda, Murshidabad, Cooch Behar
content: This marks Ms. Banerjee's second phase of anti-SIR mobilisation after her Bongaon rally last week in the refugee-dominated Matua belt

title: In Kothamangalam, LDF banks on legacy, UDF on unity, and BJP on change
content: The LDF is seeking to retain the municipality for a second consecutive term; The UDF is confident of wresting back power by presenting a united front.

title: Kerala local body election: Factionalism, poor candidate selection cost Congress dear in 2020 polls, says Mullappally Ramachandran
content: Former KPCC chief feels that candidate selection should not be left to the whims of individual leaders. He says differences among top leaders would dampen the spirits of grassroots-level workers and hence they should be resolved at the earliest

title: Kerala local body polls: Echoes of landslide in Meppadi’s electioneering
content: Survivors of the 2024 tragedy will return from various parts of Wayanad, where they now live in rented houses, to cast their votes. As the polls approach, we focus on  candidates themselves, not their parties, because none of them seems any different, says a survivor

title: Kerala local body polls 2025:  Thrissur sees a political ‘pooram’ ahead of polls
content: LDF’s development pitch, UDF’s revival push, and BJP’s expanding footprint are setting the stage for one of the most anticipated civic battle in the State

title: Still prefer to call Bangladesh a friend, hope situation there turns around: CNS Admiral Tripathi
content: The CNS said that he remains eternally optimistic and confident that things will turn around as far as Bangladesh is concerned

title: Parliament Winter session Day 1 LIVE updates: Opposition MPs urge new Rajya Sabha Chair to 'treat members fairly'
content: Lok Sabha adjourned for the day after FM Sitharaman tabled three Bills on GST, health security and excise

title: NIA raids eight locations in Kashmir in 'white-collar terror' module case
content: The NIA teams conducted searches at eight locations in Pulwama, Shopian and Kulgam districts of Kashmir

title: Extension of deadline for Special Intensive Revision of poll roll welcome: councillors
content: A councillor says that some BLOs want the process to be done quickly, as this work keeps them away from their civic responsibilities

title: Councillors call for return to zone-wise roadwork tenders
content: A councillor says that when a single contractor handles multiple areas, some places receive less attention; he alleges that contractors with connections to ruling party often dodge responsibilities

title: Parliament Winter Session: Sitaraman introduces two bills in Lok Sabha to replace GST cess on tobacco, pan masala with new levies
content: The Central Excise Amendment Bill, 2025, and The Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, will ensure that the tax incidence on sin goods like tobacco and pan masala remains the same after discontinuation of the compensation cess

title: Trinamool Congress accuses Election Commission of India of leaking info to BJP leaders
content: From day one, Suvendu Adhikari and other BJP leaders have created a sense of fear among common people by repeatedly claiming that one crore names will be removed from the voter list in the state, TMC MP Partha Bhowmik said

title: A wall that connects, in a flood that’s wrecked life and livelihood
content: More than three months after floods submerged this village and large parts of the State, reptiles and insects, some poisonous, now live in the water, making this strip of wall both a lifeline and a hazard for these families.

title: SIR extension proves that the revision is a hurried process, says Trinamool
content: The EC on Sunday announced the extension of the schedule of the ongoing SIR of electoral rolls in nine States and three Union Territories by one week

title: Young candidates infuse new energy into poll campaign
content: Political parties are fielding young candidates, some as young as 21 or still in college, who are taking on seasoned politicians and bringing much-needed enthusiasm to the local body elections

title: BJP has been ‘splitting parties’ for its entire history: Maharashtra minister
content: He said, the BJP poached one of his family members during the Assembly elections and has since poached a member of MP Rajabhau Waze’s family

title: West Bengal government directs digitisation of waqf properties on UMEED portal
content: ‘Existing Registered Waqf Properties’ are to be uploaded by the respective mutawallis within six months from the date of launch of the UMEED portal, the State government has said

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Nearly 90,000 hectares of farmland submerged in Tamil Nadu’s Cauvery delta
content: Initial reports say standing paddy crop in Mayiladuthurai, Karaikal, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Thanjavur, and Pudukkottai have been damaged due to rain caused by Cyclone Ditwah

title: Bangladeshi nationals leave India via Hakimpur border checkpost amid rising SIR fears
content: Many say they are returning after watching videos of departure and fearing arrest under ongoing SIR exercise

title: Top leaders add zest to campaigning in Kozhikode Corporation
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan, Congress Working Committee member Ramesh Chennithala, and senior BJP leader V.K. Sajeevan join candidates as campaigning peaks

title: Edappadi Palaniswami accuses Sengottaiyan of betraying AIADMK
content: Resuming his Makkalai Kaappom, Thamizhagathai Meetpom tour in Gobichettipalayam, he launches a scathing attack on the expelled leader and former MLA of the constituency, who joined actor Vijay’s TVK last week

title: Assam CM is stoking conflict, says Gaurav Gogoi
content: After a Group of Ministers’ report proposed a three-tier classification of STs to accommodate the demand of six communities for ST status, the Congress leader says the report has failed to convince that the rights of existing ST communities will remain intact. He accuses Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of doing ‘divide and rule’ politics.

title: IPFT to hold protest in Delhi demanding autonomous Tipra Territorial Council through Constitutional amendment
content: Party leaders say they have not given up the demand for a separate tribal State but primarily sought the setting up of Tipra Territorial Council in line with the Bodo Territorial Council

title: Rajasthan revokes controversial order to mark December 6 as Shaurya Diwas after drawing flak
content: The directive proposed essay competitions on themes such as Indian cultural pride and the Ram Mandir movement

title: Congress discusses Centre’s stance on SIR, National Song
content: Opposition parties may stall Parliament proceedings till the government agrees to their demand for a debate on the SIR, sources said

title: MHA writes to Governors and L-G’s to consider renaming Raj Bhavans as Lok Bhavans
content: Letter cites colonial associations in existing names; West Bengal and Ladakh change names after receiving the letter

title: Youth to take out rally in Dharwad today to get vacant posts filled
content: Meanwhile, police refuse to give permission for rally as the organisers have ‘not followed the due process’

title: Cyclone Ditwah weakens; 3 die in rain-related incidents in Tamil Nadu
content: Light to moderate rain is likely at isolated places over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry-Karaikal on December 1, with thunderstorms and lightning at a few places. Heavy rain is likely at isolated places in Tiruvallur district, according to the Regional Meteorological Centre bulletin.

title: Five killed, several injured as truck rams into vehicles in Bihar
content: “Prima facie, it appears that the truck driver dozed off behind the wheel, leading to the accident,” say police

title: Judgments must not be tossed out after their authors retire: Justice Nagarathna
content: The comment by the lone woman judge in the Supreme Court follows recent overruling of judgments by subsequent Benches

title: Akhilesh flags ‘commercialisation’ of Janeshwar Mishra Park, calls for citizens’ movement against U.P. government
content: Janeshwar Mishra Park, located in Lucknow, is one of the largest urban parks in Asia, covering approximately 376 acres

title: Divide Belagavi district for administrative convenience, says Balachandra Jarkiholi
content: The general public will benefit with the creation of Gokak and Chikkodi districts, according to the BJP MLA

title: Aim is to lift State’s urbanisation rate to national average: Bihar Minister Nitin Nabin
content: The focus is on attracting further investment and creating more employment opportunities for the State’s youth, says the Urban Development and Housing Minister

title: Woman sold two plots, apartment and took loan to give ₹2.05 crore to ‘digital arrest’ scam fraudsters
content: The complainant said she was forced to install an app, after which her email ID was linked to the app

title: Centre’s citizenship scrutiny power is ‘limited’, Election Commission tells Supreme Court
content: Election Commission tells Supreme Court that the Union government’s role is confined to reviewing foreign citizenship acquisition, defends SIR as a constitutional exercise to maintain accurate electoral rolls

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Officials on alert
content: People asked to immediately dial 112 or inform the district control room at 80999 99977 in case of emergency

title: VPN services suspended in Poonch, Rajouri districts in J&K for two months
content: In an order, Poonch District Magistrate Ashok Kumar Sharma said the police apprised them of an unprecedented high usage of VPNs in the past few days at different locations of the district by suspicious internet users. The two districts, part of the Pir Panjal valley, are close to the Line of Control.

title: Telangana to compete with global nations: Revanth Reddy
content: The Chief Minister said that the government is striving to strengthen the State’s economy and ensure employment for the youth, besides providing quality healthcare and education for all

title: New finds highlight Great Nicobar project site’s biodiversity
content: Regular discoveries of new species, including the latest finds, highlights the rich biodiversity of the island, which is reported to have 650 species of plants and over 1,800 species of fauna

title: Govt. issues order for KSCMF to procure and supply maize to distilleries
content: The step comes comes after distillers pointed out at the high cost of ₹2,639 per quintal if they had to purchase maize from NAFED or NCCF

title: QB Rodgers calls out WRs after 'boo-worthy' loss
content: After an injured Aaron Rodgers finished one of the worst passing games of his career, the Steelers QB said he hopes his wide receivers show up during the next film sessions and run the right routes.

title: Bonitto seals win after Broncos switch up call on D
content: After the Broncos tweaked their defensive call during a timeout, linebacker Nick Bonitto swatted away Marcus Mariota's pass on a 2-point conversion attempt to preserve Denver's 27-26 overtime win against Washington on Sunday night.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Kiffin takes LSU job, won't finish year with Rebels
content: Lane Kiffin is the new coach at LSU, and he will not continue with Ole Miss on its College Football Playoff run as the Rebels promoted Pete Golding to head coach.

title: Sources: Spartans target Fitzgerald as new coach
content: Pat Fitzgerald, 50, has emerged as the target of Michigan State's coaching search, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Sunday night, confirming a report, and the sides are working toward a deal, which is expected to be finalized in the near future.

title: Sources: Kentucky expected to fire Mark Stoops
content: Kentucky is expected to fire football coach Mark Stoops, sources told ESPN on Sunday, with the process set to formally play out Monday.

title: Titans' Chestnut says Jags punter threatened him
content: Titans running back Julius Chestnut alleged that Jaguars punter Logan Cooke threatened to kill him during Sunday's game. "I was just trying to play hard, and he came up to me and said he was going to kill me," Chestnut said.

title: 76ers' Embiid returns in chaotic 2OT loss to Hawks
content: Joel Embiid, Paul George and Tyrese Maxey shared the court for the first time this season Sunday night, but that became a footnote in a chaotic double-overtime loss to the Hawks.

title: 🔎 How Kiffin's decision impacted sports books
content: How sportsbooks are evaluating Ole Miss and the College Football Playoff race, and more on NFL underdogs winning big on Thanksgiving.

title: Can Ohio State be beaten? Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: Women's Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: Awful in first half, magic in second: Joshua Zirkzee leads Man United comeback
content: Man United and Joshua Zirkzee had a poor first half vs. Crystal Palace, but one moment of magic turned everything around.

title: Liverpool needed Isak, Wirtz to ease pressure on Slot, and they did
content: A fine performance from Florian Wirtz and a first goal for Alexander Isak eased some pressure on Liverpool.

title: Week 13 winners and losers: Bijan Robinson runs wild, Davante Adams makes history
content: Bijan Robinson, A.J. Brown and Patrick Mahomes led the way with big Week 13 performances, while Lamar Jackson, Saquon Barkley and Jaxon Smith-Njigba were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Kentucky fires Mark Stoops: Top candidates, transfers, recruits
content: Stoops departs after 13 years at Kentucky, leaving behind a job that could attract some interesting candidates.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 14, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: McLaren's Qatar blunder has it on the brink of a 2007 rerun
content: In 2007, McLaren refused to favor either of its drivers, costing the team a title. After another botched call in Qatar, is history repeating itself?

title: 23XI vs. NASCAR trial: Why Michael Jordan & Co. want to tear up stock car racing
content: The antitrust suit against NASCAR goes to court on Monday, in a trial that could tear at the fabric of stock car racing as we know it.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye Semenyo move in January
content: Manchester City could move to sign AFC Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Congress Chief's Jagdeep Dhankhar Redux In Rajya Sabha Leaves BJP Fuming
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday congratulated Vice President CP Radhakrishnan on taking over as Chairman of the Upper House, while simultaneously voicing disappointment at not being able to bid farewell to his predecessor Jagdeep Dhankhar

title: The Unresolved Questions Of Face Transplantation 20 Years On
content: James Partridge, severely burned in a fire at 18, spent his life advocating for people with "visible difference" through charities like Changing Faces and Face Equality International.

title: Municipal Councils, Local Bodies Polls In Maharashtra Tomorrow
content: Maharashtra will witness local body elections on Monday with voting scheduled for 242 municipal councils and 46 nagar panchayats, marking the first phase of a three-tier process mandated by the Supreme Court.

title: Centre Orders Preloading Smartphones With This App For Cybersecurity: Report
content: India's telecoms ministry has privately asked all smartphone makers to preload all new devices with a state-owned cybersecurity app, a government order showed, a move set to spark a tussle with Apple, which typically dislikes such directives.

title: Japan Princess' Admiration Sparks Call To Change Male-Only Succession Law
content: During a visit to Nagasaki with Emperor Naruhito and Empress Masako, the sound of her name being screamed by well-wishers along the roads overwhelmed the cheers for her parents.

title: New H-1B Approvals For Indian IT Fall To 4,573, Lowest In 10 Years
content: The number of first-time H-1B visa applications approved for major Indian IT companies has fallen drastically to just 4,573 --the lowest in the last 10 years. As compared to 2015, the figure has gone down substantially by 70% and by 37%

title: 'If I Had More Time...': UP Poll Official's (BLO) Last Video Before Suicide
content: A day after a 46-year-old teacher working as a Booth Level Officer (BLO) was found dead at his home in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, a video of what could be his last message to his family has emerged.

title: Video: Men Kneel, Plead With Woman To Contest Sarpanch Poll In Telangana
content: A video from Telangana's Mahabubabad district has gone viral after capturing an unusual scene: several men requesting a woman to contest the local body elections as sarpanch, with one of them even dropping to his knees and clutching her feet

title: Prove Age, Impose Penalties: How Australia Plans Its U-16 Social Media Ban
content: Australia will soon ban under-16s from the likes of Facebook and TikTok, a world-first move of huge interest to all those worried about the harms of social media.

title: Bihar Wedding Turns Tragic, Bride's Cousin Killed During Celebratory Firing
content: A wedding celebration in Thanua village under the Shivsagar police station area of Bihar's Rohtas district turned into a tragedy on Monday morning when a member of the bride's family was killed during celebratory firing.

title: UP Man Shoots Girlfriend After Family Fixes Her Marriage
content: A 22-year-old woman was shot at in Uttar Pradesh's Nanglaber village by a man she had been in a relationship with for five years after he learnt that her marriage had been fixed with someone else, police said.

title: Haryana Number Plate 'HR88B8888', Sold For Rs 1.17 Crore, To Be Reauctioned
content: 'HR88B8888', the number plate that went viral last week for being sold for Rs 1.17 crore in Haryana will be reauctioned after the bidder failed to pay the amount within the given period.

title: "Those Who Bite Sit Inside": Row After Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury Brings Dog To Parliament
content: The Congress found itself in a rather unusual controversy after a party lawmaker arrived at Parliament with a puppy this morning.

title: Parliament Winter Session Live Updates Day 1: Lok Sabha Adjourned Till Tomorrow Amid Chaos Over SIR
content: The winter session of the Parliament is slated to continue until December 19 with 15 sittings planned over 19 days.

title: Kerala Techie Arrested For Harassing Cabin Crew On Dubai-Hyderabad Flight
content: A 34-year-old software engineer was arrested at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (RGI) for allegedly sexually harassing a female cabin crew member aboard an Air India flight from Dubai to Hyderabad.

title: Who Is Tanishka Kulkarni? Sharad Pawar's Grandson Marries Long-Time Partner
content: Yugendra Pawar, the grandson of Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Sharad Pawar, got married to his longtime partner Tanishka Kulkarni on Sunday. Senior political leaders and members of the Pawar political family were in attendance.

title: How IIT Kharagpur Shaped Google CEO Sundar Pichai Beyond Metallurgy
content: In the quiet corridors of IIT Kharagpur's Nehru Hall of Residence, there is a room that has become a symbol of possibility-Room B-308. This modest space once housed Sundar Pichai, now the CEO of Google and Alphabet, during his B.Tech days

title: Minor Rape Victim Asks Supreme Court To Cancel Asaram's Bail
content: The victim's lawyer, Aljo Joseph, argued that the self-styled godman Asaram has been travelling across the country and is not seriously ill, therefore, his bail should be cancelled.

title: Sheikh Hasina's Family Hit With Fresh Sentences In Corruption Case
content: In a continuation of the corruption cases against Sheikh Hasina and her family members, more trouble has emerged for the former Prime Minister, her sister, and her niece, British Member of Parliament Tulip Siddiq.

title: Elon Musk Was Asked If He Could Get A Tattoo, What Would It Be? His Reply
content: Billionaire Elon Musk might not have a tattoo, but he has revealed what he may get when he decides to get inked.

title: Birder alerts about Rock Eagle Owl nest; quarrying stopped for a month
content: Sudhakar Reddy Udumula is the Editor (Investigation) at the Times of India, Hyderabad. Following the trail of migration and drought across the rustic landscape of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, Sudhakar reported extensively on government apathy, divisive politics, systemic gender discrimination, agrarian crisis and the will to survive great odds. His curiosity for peeking behind the curtain triumphed over the criminal agenda of many scamsters in the highest political and corporate circles, making way for breaking stories such as Panama Papers Scam, Telgi Stamp Paper Scam, and many others. His versatility in reporting extended to red corridors of left-wing extremism where the lives of security forces and the locals in Maoist-affected areas were key points of investigation. His knack for detail provided crucial evidence of involvement from overseas in terrorist bombings in Hyderabad. Read More
